summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James island. It details coordination between law enforcement agencies, including discussions on probable cause, transportation, lodging, and equipment. The email references a prior search of Epstein's NYC residence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the planned search warrant for his private island, Little St. James. His previous NYC residence was also searched.

events.title: Planned conference call on LSJ probable cause
events.description: A planned conference call between NY and SDNY to discuss probable cause for a search warrant for Little St. James island.

events.title: Initial coordination email for island search
events.description: An email sent to coordinate assistance for the planned search of Jeffrey Epstein's island, copying relevant personnel.

events.title: Previous search of Epstein's NYC residence
events.description: Reference to a prior search warrant executed at Epstein's NYC residence, which initially was for pictures and proof of residency but expanded to a full search, resulting in 845 pictures taken over 13 hours.

events.title: Previous investigation 12 years prior
events.description: A question is raised about whether a person had any involvement with the Epstein investigation from approximately 12 years earlier (circa 2007).

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in August 2019.
The search planning involved multiple agencies including CBP (Customs and Border Protection), USCG (Coast Guard), and coordination with the SDNY (Southern District of New York).
A prior search of Epstein's NYC residence yielded significant evidence (845 pictures) after the scope was expanded upon entry.
The document indicates an intent to isolate the 2019 case from the previous Epstein investigation from approximately 12 years earlier.
Logistical challenges for the island search included transportation, limited lodging due to a hurricane, and extreme heat and humidity.
